channel.title: INtopBackup

item.title: One week into post-Assad rule in Syria - a view from Damascus
item.description: Morning Edition host Leila Fadel reports from Damascus, in the first week in a half-century that the Assad family did not rule the country.

item.title: Australia says 'Bali Nine' drug smugglers have returned home
item.description: Australia says the five remaining members of the drug ring have returned home after almost 20 years in Indonesian prison.

item.title: Assad's fall came too late for one NPR reporter's father
item.description: Assad's fall came too late for the father of NPR's Diaa Hadid, who was briefly detained by Syrian forces during their occupation of northern Lebanon.

item.title: 'I don't want to end up in a box when I die - I want an eco funeral'
item.description: Artist Rachel Hawthorn says an eco-friendly burial at a natural site is a "no-brainer" for her.

item.description: The US government says the flying objects pose no threat to national security, but their origin and intentions remain unclear.
